column11: The Dutch Hospital Shopping Centre in Colombo is a must-visit spot for anyone exploring the city. Set in a beautifully restored colonial building, it offers a great mix of upscale boutiques, unique souvenir shops, and excellent dining options. There is nothing much to shop basically but the ambiance is charming, with a blend of history and modernity that makes for a pleasant experience. Stylish cafes and good local food.. very famous ministry of crab

Visited for lunch during a city visit to Colombo. The quality of the food itself was fine, but the service extremely slow and inefficient. Very unpleasant if you place your order at 13:30 and the bus leaves at 15:30. When dinner finally arrives at 15:15, there is actually no time to eat relaxed. In short: if you have all the time in the world, it is a nice place to visit. Do you want to spend less time at lunch, than rather skip.

Downtown Colombo maintains few colonial buildings, and those that have resisted are immersed in recent achievements that, good or bad, are still out of scale. The Dutch Hospital is one of them. Yellow, with the columns of the wooden porch, keeps inside large halls and courtyards. Its construction has an uncertain date, certainly a few years before 1681. It was built in front of the port to assist personnel sailing for the Dutch India Company. It is now a shopping mall with Western products (and prices).
Definitely recommended! Go for a meal or for shopping. I shopped for souvenirs at the Luv SL by Odel store. I would have loved to have a meal at one of the many restaurants here too!

Loads of eateries bars and gift shops now abound in what was once a place where one probaly went to die before modern medicines against basic illnesses existed. Supect that there has been a considerable amount of refurbishment but the place looks unique and offers an amazing haven from the sun and the hussle of the city. Beautifully restored, the Old Colombo Dutch Hospital is now a modern shopping precinct. A hospital was first established here in 1681 to serve members of the  Dutch East India Company, it later became the Colombo Apothecaries under British rule and served as the Colombo Fort Police Station in the late 20th century and ultimately became a shopping precinct in 2011. We probably did not see all of the complex but there seems to be very few shops and those that we did see sell handicrafts, souvenirs, spices, gemstones, etc. The vast majority of tenancies are restaurants, cafes and bars; some are very pricy, but there is a range to suit most pockets and claim to offer great culinary experiences. We certainly enjoyed our snack at Java. Nicely setout courtyards for al fresco dining.

Most of the shops and restaurants here are expectedly overpriced. We ate at a very local looking restaurant and still paid a good amount of money from Sri Lankan standards. You may find Java lounge here, which is the official Starbucks in Sri Lanka. We had good coffee there. There is also a currency museum here where you can learn about the history of Sri Lankan coins and banknotes and can also buy the coins and banknotes for your collection. You should definitely spare a few minutes for this museum.

Dutch Hospital considered as the oldest building in Colombo Fort area. Built during the Dutch colonial era in Sri Lanka. Currently a heritage building and a place for  shopping and dining. They've got few of lovely places for food and to buy Sri Lankan souvenir gifts.

Opposite the World Trade Centre is a fine shopping arcade with restaurants and smart shops including the Ministry of Crab restaurant and Odel’s and Barefoot shops. It is the oldest building in Colombo, built in 1669 a fine example of 17th century Dutch colonial architecture, with 4 sides around a central courtyard, open verandahs and thick walls. Floors had terracotta tiles floors, high beamed ceilings, and airy rooms with large windows, all designed to keep the wards cool. It was the first hospital to be built by the Dutch in Asia and served officers of the Dutch East India Company and Dutch sailors. However, when the British arrived in 1796, it ceased to be a hospital and served as a military barracks. Surprisingly perhaps, the building was still in existence, due largely to its solid construction, when Sri Lanka became independent in 1948. Since then the building has been used for various purposes. Before the 1980’s is was used by the Colombo Apothecaries. It was restored in 1984 by the architect Ashley de Vos. For more than a decade, it was Fort Police station. In 1996 it suffered severe damage from then LTTE attack on the World Trade Centre and It was abandoned, fenced off and largely forgotten. It was scheduled for demolition but in 2011, it was realized that this building could be saved, if it could be put to practical use. It was converted into a smart shopping arcade in 2011 whilst retaining the Dutch Architectural style. And what a fine job they have made of it.

Good place in Colombo city shoppers with lot of varieties of items and also delicious foods and beverages in their.

Must try here is TEA Cocktail at Heladiv Tea Bar. its a must must try. Even the ceylon Spa here is nice and they had some nice offers while we were there. Overall a fun place to spend the evening

Enjoyed the architecture and the ambience a good place to explore. If you want to try a good Tea here there are very special cafes and nice place to scour some souvenirs. If you stay nearby it's worth it.

This is an old Dutch hospital converted into some shops and a few bars and eateries. Shops largely sell touristy goods. Bars and restaurants serve a variety of food and drinks. It is a good place to chill out in the evenings when the heat is not so intense.

Nice coffee shops along with an odel store where people can buy souvenirs and clothes. The price of articles are on the higher side but the quality is definitely good.

Walking around and  admiring Dutch-colonial architecteur from Pubs, offices, restaurants, shopping stores are great. U can get snack and drink there then go around for shopping. There were some stores selling local souvenirs.
Walked around for the nice scenery and architecture. Also stopped by for a nice iced mocha which goes down well on a very hot sunny day
This old Dutch hospital has been converted very nicely into a smallish shopping centre with nice restaurants and is a very relaxing place.
This old Dutch hospital is converted into a area with restaurants and shops. Love the way they made this hospital into a shoppng area. Very relaxing inside this building.
When you have a time must visit and it will make you happy and a great shopping experience that you will be happy with everything

This place was pretty cool. Neat to hear about it’s history. Great food. At night they have music, DJs and live bands you can dance or sit and chat. A little side market to browse some neat little gifts. Definitely a tourist gathering place, fun to meet people from around the world that were either just beginning their Sri Lanka travels or coming to an end

So, obviously Friday and weekend nights are crowded and often have fun events. Colonial structure retouched with modern architecture  has created an amazing price of art, making it a popular photography location. Night view is the best.

I wouldn’t call it a shopping mall but you find some good local stores and then mostly restaurants and bars. Worth a visit.

The square was beautiful. I saw a couple of restaurants and a department store. All contemporary establishment in a historic building. Loved the ambiance! Worth the visit.

Lots of bistros and bars , cafes and restaurants to choose from... there are some small shops that sell souvenirs and local items , and be sure to bargain if you are intending to buy things here. Nice to take a walk along the buildings which speak of the cultural heritage and history. But other than, nothing much to be done. Best to visit in the evenings when all the bistros and bars are operational!
The shops aren't cheap but there is a lot of good places to eat and "chill" with the family / friends you are travelling with

We were pleasantly surprised at the layout of the hospital precinth. It has multiple shopping and eating preferences including the iconic Ministry of Crab restaurant. Just outside are the World Trade centre towers and Fairway Colombo hotel is just behind it.

Located in the heart of the city, the Dutch Hospital is considered to be the oldest building in Colombo and its inner courtyard is nowadays a cute but quite poor shopping and dining precinct. In terms of food, you can find here the  Ministry of Crab Restaurant, Heladiv Tea Club and Colombo Fort Café. For shopping you have a small Barefoot shop and a few small souvenir stores. A nice, little area, worth a quick stop..

A great place to meet with friends and family or even on your own. It has shops and restaurants to wonder around and take the view of Sri Lanka’s ‘Twin Towers’. A nice relaxing place.

This is a nice place to stay with plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. If you stay here a lot of things are within walking distance or just a short tuk tuk ride away. The shopping was disappointing as it was very limited and did not have much for tourists.

Got something for everyone. Can do a bit of shopping, lunch and dinner, drinks and also a spa! Have gone to the the spa here and it's just great. Might need to book. But at the back, there's few more pubs as well. Great place to hang out day and even night.

Our friend took us to Dutch Hospital, saying it was one of the most popular sites in Colombo. It was beautifully renovated but there's not so much to see unless you're looking for up market shops. Would have been better if there had been some kind of historic perspective offered rather than just shopping. Free to go in and stroll around.
A pleasant area with some colonial era buildings remaining. Away from most of the hustle of Colombo, a place to enjoy food and drink.

This place is very popular among every one. There are many different types of stores and the services of them also different. The service for customers should increase a bit as per my knowledge since this place is not only for locals. Anyway hope everything will get in to better on my next visit..

But it is NOT a shopping complex as there are few shops _ Spa Ceylon and a few others but that's it. We walked all around looking for more shops but they aren't there! Still history and architecture is interesting. An enjoyable experience.

This is a former Dutch hospital now converted to a shopping and entertainment Center. Very nice atmosphere and lots of options to chose from. Evenings and weekends this place turns into a carnival....

But it’s mainly restaurants and jewels and nothing else. Lovely views but it’s not a day out and I wouldn’t recommend travelling from anywhere to see it. A lot of Sri Lanka is like this I’m afraid and I’d only recommend seeing what you do as you pass through. We’ve spent a month in Sri Lanka from top to bottom and it’s been WAY too long and very much the same things throughout. Highly recommend only visiting for a maximum of 10 days and doing a couple of nights in each place. Ignore any travel agent who bullsh*ts you otherwise like ours did.

Sympathetic renovation has restored an iconic Colombo location, but it's mainly expensive retail Outlets filled with foreign tourists.  Unless you are nearly it's not worth more than a walk through.

I always stay behind in fairway as it gives a chance not to get bored. A spa a tea shop now becoming a pub a crab restaurant a pub a japanese restaurant and a few tourist shops That's it another couple.of pubs But all said and done still has a food feel with nice music some bands and things happening It takes u away from everything So I would rate it high just for the ambience itself
Very disappointed in this site. Nothing more than a couple of shops and 3 cafes. More interesting things to see an do in Colombo.

Went for dinner at one of the restaurants in this precinct, and was blown away by the ambiance and great vibe this place puts out. There are some nice shops down here as well as restaurants, but what was more importantly noticeable was the heritage of the place had been kept to a high level. We were also lucky to catch the last set of the band playing in the middle of the precinct, and this was not only enjoyable but also added to the ambiance and environment. Would highly recommend every tourist head down this way, as you'll enjoy it, and will be very surprising if you don't enjoy it.

This is considered to be the oldest building in the Fort Area and well worth a visit. There are fun shops and good food!
I was here over the full moon holiday so many of the shops/ restaurants where closed. It’s a great area with nice buildings.

With a distinct allure of Dutch-colonial architecture, Dutch Hospital is a precinct of gastronomic adventure and souvenir shopping. From Pubs and Cafe's to Coffeehouses and Restaurants offering unique experiences in cuisine, to a line-up of Boutique-shops and a Spa, with an splendid courtyard to relax and unwind. Dutch Hospital is also the home for Colombo's acclaimed seafood venue, "The Ministry of Crab". A Visit Worthy of it's Memorable Experience!

Book in for Lunch at The Ministry of Crab, shop at Barefoot (best place for really excellent quality souvenirs), enjoy a drink in one of the bars or simply leave the boys drinking in the bars while you shop!
You will find many places in Lanka where they have converted old Dutch building in shopping complex. This is one of the better one with nice cafes and colour shops.
Another old dutch period building turned into shopping place. This place is house of cool cafes and shops.
a nice mix of restaurants and souvenir shops this is a must see in Colombo.  dont forget to book ahead for the crab!
Explored here due to hotel location very good choice for food and places to drink. Enjoyed the architecture and the ambience a good place to explore

This was built as a hospital by the Dutch in 1681 to look after the health of officers and other staff serving under the Dutch East India Company. The hospital's close proximity to the harbor allowed it to serve Dutch seafarers. Over the years, this has been used for several different purposes (Colombo Fort Police station, Colombo apothecary, etc.). In 1996, It suffered heavy damage from the LTTE attack that followed the Central Bank bombing and in 2011, it was transformed into a shopping and dining precinct, preserving it's historic architecture. Today, this is a prominent venue facilitated with a number of bars, restaurants and shops, that also provides a great view of the city.

Here however is where the greatest concentration of western tourists gather and thus is where the most annoying, persistant tuktuk drivers wait to jump all over them. Expect to get ripped off by any of them. Will not be returning.

There is a barefoot souvenir shop which sells really nice gifts. And that s about it. Restaurants here are expensive and serve small portions of mediocre westerner food. Some good desserts though. Would recommend to skip this place altogether.
Worth to visit this place. There are some souvenirs shop,  pubs and cafe. You can also sit at the open space area

The Dutch Hospital is a trendy area with historical significance in the Colombo Fort area.   I enjoyed the various food options and unique, boutique shops.  I highly recommend visiting this spot during the evening when there are more people enjoying its ambiance.

The Dutch hospital shopping center is centrally located and is easily accessible. Alot of trendy restaurant and boutique shops. Expensive. A visit would not last more than a couple of hours. Evening visit is recommended and weekends are crowded.
A nice place to hangout with friends. Friday & Saturday nights live band plays. Food and drink also available. Nothing much to do in day time other than shopping.

This was a hospital at some point of time now housing various restaurants and shops. The building itself is beautiful with its red tiles with the surrounding grounds. Some of the restaurants are really good here although a little pricy. Grab a cup if coffee, sit down at one of the benches and see the city pass by you.

We were here for Ministry of Crab and while awaiting for our reservation decided to have tea in the court yard. The whole building has an airy, very colonial feel to it. There is a brief history of the building at the entrance and then it starts to make sense. I loved the stones as flooring and the wooden windows. We enjoyed our cup of tea and did a little souvenir shopping as well. The place is right smack in town and towered by hotel buildings. You cannot miss it, go at night to sit under the stars and have tea.
This is really a good place for tourist to visit especially if you are looking for an international cousine. It's mostly eateries which quite a good selection of restaurants. Shopping? Not so much.

Its a collection of shops and restaurants. In the evening somedays you get to hear some live music under the stars. I like the Nature secret spa and spa ceylon out let here. Also love the food offered at Iko Tai which is run my hotel Hilton. Parking is a huge problem though.
This is a very nice, expensive, though really comfortable shopping experience here. No bustle and variety of beautiful things. Refreshing!
I enjoyed shopping here and bought some quality  souvenirs at a reasonable price .I ate at a couple of the restaurants and enjoyed my food at both .The history of the building was also interesting.
A "must visit" place in downtown Colombo. Nice place to hang out. Good place to have dinner with a choice of restaurants, although a bit expensive.

This is an ideal place to spend your evening in Colombo. There is usually a live band performing. You can have your food, drinks and even do a little shopping here. It also holds a historical value because this was a old dutch hospital (As the name imply)
having many cafe, resturant, shops made with colonial style. feel change from other places in colombo.
The place is very well maintained with amazing shopping at the odel outlet.  Though the eating and shopping options are limited

This place in Colombo is very popular with tourists.The place has nice restaurants and it feels you are in Europe.  You can easily pass few hours just exploring and sipping a drink at few of the bars and then can choose a restaurant for your choice of cuisine.
Nice place but over priced , variety of cousins ESPECIALLY sea food .. worth visiting. Nice outdoor settings.

Colombo's top dining experiences call this rejuvenated heritage structure home, as well as some good shopping destinations, although I much prefer the one in Galle. Can get pretty crowded on some hours and also not well laid out with signs so you can easily the other restaurants and shops at the back.

Parking is an huge issue. A drop off pick up option would be nice. A lot of eateries are available. Depending on the requirement we can pick the restaurent. If you feeling party and pubish, it is also available. Shopping is also available. For all tastes. Sri Lankan items are available. A must visit place for anyone coming to sri lanka
An interesting mix of shopping and eateries, The Dutch Hospital offers many options to spend a fun evening.
Lots of good restaurants to pick from but don't bother with the shopping there ... the shops are over priced and nothing great at all :(
Love the hype and energy on weekends the place to be if you are around specially Friday nights crazy music and dancing
Not so much to see there...There are several restaurants but few choices on shopping only Odel and Barefoot.

Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct is a hospital during Dutch colonial era and presently turned into a Mall with, spas with many restaurants. Therefore it is a historical place.  Therefore you can select the restaurant to dine at. The shops sell many items including souvenirs, Jewelry, arts and crafts etc. It is well clean and maintained by the authorities. The staff is courteous and they provide professional service together with Sri Lankan hospitality. It is located closer to the sea and quite spacious. The place is comparatively cooler one and can hang around here relaxing. More crowd is seen during the weekends as people do shopping and enjoying during their holidays. Live music too are found during the week ends. It’s a great atmosphere.

Popped along to the Dutch Hospital while visiting Colombo thinking it would be alot larger than it actually is! There is only onw gift shop and the rest consists of restaurants. The restaurants are lovwly and some offer live music in the evening but can also be quite pricey if on a budget!

This is a historical location. One of a few historical buildings still existing in Colombo. Not a big location. Has a few restaurants, including the famous and delicious, Ministry of Crab. Worth a visit for dinner!
Came here at new years and it wax empty with only a few resturants and cafes open. Its nice away from the heat to just relax and chill out

If you are in Colombo, you must visit Galle Fort and if you find yourself here in Galle Fort, you must visit Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct. You can find Barefoot shop here and some other souvenir shop here, but you must go to Ministry of Crab on the other end. It is an experience the you will enjoy.

Very nice place to visit with friends and relatives alike. Good ambiance, very good crowd reasonable price for drinks and snacks. Name is Dutch Hospital but a very nicely preserved old heritage site. Must visit once.

This small shopping area was located directly accross our hotel and we passed through many times. There only 2 stores that we saw ODEL and Barefoot. This Odel store was definitely the best we saw. And The Barefoot store as well although quite pricey. Theres mostly restaurants majority not Halaal and serving alcohol. However its an unusual set up and quite lovely. We'd get our tuk tuk drivers to drop us off here and take the short walk through to our hotel. I suggest Majestic plaza and Liberty plaza for a better shopping experience.

Located closer to a complex of hotels and offices,  is this place which comes to life in the evening with niche restaurants blending so well with popular joints. A perfect place to stroll around looking for the joint of your preference or after a sumptuous dinner.

Good foodie place, but not much to do around, perhaps take selfies and sit out. Friday night there was a band playing outside tap house. During day not many around and restaurants were empty except ministry of crab.
Had gone there in the evening.  Lots of restaurants to try ur food.  The shopping experience wasn't that good
Kidna like this place, a few pubs, a few shops, a few restaurants. Mostly populated by the colombo rich kids and a few tourists its a fun place to hangout at but definitely not a must see

With and old-world architecture, it's a nice place for food and drinks, especially in the evening. There are quite a few restaurants that serve good food and many different cuisines, and there's even a Burger King for the budget conscious. Being in the middle of the tourist area, beware of touts just rushing out to you from all corners (once you leave the premises) offering too-good-to-be-true deals.
This is a rather small place but I rather have quality than quantity. I did my Spa Ceylon shopping here and had some tea at Heladvin. Had dinner at Ministry of Crab. I like this!

We visited the Dutch Hospital one evening just for a look around and certainly weren't disappointed. As the name suggests it is the refurbished Dutch Hospital, a beautiful very old building. It is the oldest building in the Fort area of Colombo. It is now a spacious area consisting of two single storey courtyards, full of quaint souvenir shops, bars and cafes. There is a wide variety of eating places so my recommendation would be to wander around and choose one on the day! I believe you need to book well in advance for the crab one though. I have heard that there is live music every night Wednesday through to Sunday so it can get a bit noisy but with that there is a great atmosphere! If you want a quieter night, choose a Monday or Tuesday! It is a fantastic place just to sit in the shade with a refreshment and people watch!

It's an old Dutch hospital turned into a big courtyard with lot of restaurants and bars  and few branded Sri Lankan shops. It is opposite world Trade Centre and close to Hilton therefore parking is always problem here. It is worth visiting for drinks and food rather than shopping.
There are plenty of eating and drinking choices in this re-purposed colonial complex. A few craft and souvenir shops too.

In this case the name does not say it all - not what I expected. This is an old Dutch single level hospital building turned into a courtyard surrounded mostly by eateries. It's cool and quiet and a very pleasant place to stop for a drink - a sangria for us - or a meal. There are a couple of nice souvenir shops, but 'shopping' isn't its claim to fame. Recommended for a pleasant break though.
Came here as this is one iconic place in Colombo and did not get disappointed. The variety of restaurants, shops and bars make it a nice place to stay and spend few hours
This is a nice little centre with some nice places to grab a bite or eat or cook off with a drink. However I feel there could be more in there as it's a bit quiet.

Galle, in general, has great shopping options inside the Fort, especially for textiles & souvenirs.The Dutch Hospital has several lovely restaurants and bars serving a variety of cuisines at very reasonable prices.

This area is steeped in history and has seen the benefit of some really nice restoration.  Historically it had been built by the Dutch as a hospital and fell into disrepair when the Dutch moved out.  It really looks quite good now. It's hardly a shopping precinct with only a couple of shops that sell souvenirs but it does have several restaurants situated around a courtyard that are open all day and evening.  At the planning stage the architect forgot to draw outside lighting on his plans and as such both the courtyard area and the roadside sitting area are in darkness when night falls and sadly this makes the area look a little dim and dull. Many young local people meet up and sit in the dim light in the when night falls
Modern shops and restaurants in old setting.  Makes for interesting mix of old and new. Enjoyable and pleasant place.

It was located walking distance from our hotel so we decided to have a look at the premises. The setup is very nice. There are amazing restaurants in this shopping complex. There are souvenir shops selling beautiful souvenirs. Over all a great place to eat or shop for souvenirs.

We visited in the evening and although busy it was never frenetic and all the restaurants and shops looked inviting. We ate well at Hapo's Colombo Fort Cafe and enjoyed happy hour drinks in the cobbled courtyard area. The crowd was mainly young but there were also families with children.

This dimly lit outdoor eating place is one of the best places in the heart of Colombo to enjoy quality time. There are variety of places to eat ranging in prices. It was not overcrowded the day we went but it might be specially in the weekend. I was tranquilized by the serenity and the blend of old and modern architecture. This is a truly amazing place to be and totally relax yourself!

This place is really amazing at night, have visited many times and would visit over and over again, looking at the night sky with the two tall scrapers at night is beautiful, it gives a feel of a foreign city at night.All dinning options are really great and nothing to complain about it.Would recommend anyone to visit here.

There are many Dutch hospital shopping areas in Sri Lanka... this probably the most central in Colombo 7 (the good part of town) Has a good Burger King and a Dilmah Tea lounge which is great for Ceylon Tea. Some other luxury shops and restaurants complete the shopping centre which is good if you're visiting the memorial nearby... but not something you should really go out of your way for!
This old building has been given a new lease of life, inside there are great restaurants and a couple of shops. It is not a hive of activity but worth the visit.

I love these hospital shopping precincts.  They have one in all the main cities that I went to and I love them! The layout is nice and I feel like it's a good use of space. Definitely try out the Dilmah tea lounge! Good crepes and ice tea.

The old Dutch hospital is considered to be the oldest building in the Colombo fort area. Its now a heritage building and shopping and dinning precinct. Its a good chilling place with friends. There are many bars and restaurants amongst is the famous Ministry of crabs.
Loved the ambience, shopping not to forget the delicious CRAB from Ministry of crab. Lots of bars and great food outlets. Must visit in Colombo !!

So many restaurants, all high quality, an ODEL outlet, spend an evening here. Nice open space in the centre to while away time with friends. Don't miss it if you are in Colombo. I ensure I come here each time I am in town.

This is a great place to run in and pick up last minute items when you don't want to brave the crazy traffic and crowds at the flagship Odel store in ward place in particular. It's easy to get to, well known and has a wide variety of easily purchased items. The precinct itself is also home to the famous Ministry of Crab restaurant, a Spa Ceylon day spa and a small Barefoot store among other restaurants and little shops. The space is not large but not small either and is accessible and a good option for relaxing and shopping at the same time. There are plenty of tuk tuks surrounding the place and the cab companies are all familiar with its location.

Nice setting for some tourist restaurants and 4 Shops. There is as well one bar with live music for the young and trendy. Nothing around. If you stay in one of the hotels close by a good Option. Prices are on european level
This is no shopping mall ! There was 2-4 shops, so NO shopping mall!!  Restaurants only. And some spa.

Went here with my sister. It is a very nice place to have lunch or dinner, the restaurants looked very good. Unfortunately we had already eaten and only had a beer here. You can also read and learn about the history of the place. It's a getaway place, hidden from the busy streets just outside.
A shopping complex together with restaurants. I noticed that most of the time youth prefer to hand over at this place. A good place to meet up with your friends , ofcause not under a cloudy sky.
The old hospital has been converted into a minor shopping mall with several bars and restaurants. Its Ok but nothing to write home about!

Definitely a must go! We had a hotel nearby so we just crossed the road and entered into the Dutch Hospital area. Its a mixture of shops, spas and a vast variety of restaurants from fine dining at the ministry of crab to fast food lole burger king and puzza hut and inbetween java lounge.
The guys who is visiting Sri Lanka must go to this Mall Wow" this mall was nicely maintained by the authorities. and I must say that staff over there is fantastic

I would like to comment how pleased I was with the service provided to me . During my recent trip I felt like I am at home hotel staff were excellent very hopeful specially the staff at the executive e floor and lounge. Very professional

Walked round the inside colonnade and visited Luv Us Boutique and later that evening the Ministry of Crab restaurant. Good to see how well preserved is this old building and the clever use that has been made of it - boutique, bars, tea shop and restaurants. Well worth a visit.

Very nice area for shopping, eating or drinking. When we passed through there one night, there was live music! Really impressive how they turned an old hospital into a shopping area. It's a beautiful building.
Amazing shopping area for casual shopping, food and for experiencing sri lankan hospitality and tradition.. One place one stop destination, a must visit
Many choices of restaurants here. Also offers some shopping options. Clean and classy. Very close to the beach and World Trade Centre.
A must visit place for all the tourists. It was not really crowded, though. We went here for lunch during our visit. Although, there were not many shops.
The precinct with historical heritage is carefully restored to house and accommodate many several setting to chill out with food drinks and shopping
Walking in the fresh air on a lonely Friday evening, cannot find a better place for a sopping complex in the boundaries of Colombo
Its a very expensive place flooded with tourists. Not much presence of luxury brands here. I would say after reading reviews on TA and been there this place is overhyped not worth a visit.
The complex has many expensive stores with not so interesting merchandise, and some expensive restaurants for tourists. Not worth the trip unless you want to spend 15 minutes walking through.

We only spent a day in Colombo, and the Dutch Hospital was the highlight of our time there.  We went in the evening and had a very nice meal, did some shopping, and enjoyed live music.  It's a great place to wile away the evening hours.  There weren't a lot of locals there; it seemed to be intended mainly for tourists.  5 star quality, but I'm rating it 4 stars because of the prices.  The food wasn't too expensive, but the souvenirs in the shops were.
The Dutch Hospital Precinct is beautiful but gets lost in the city buildings around it. Very expensive and touristy so we didn't buy anything for this reason a bit unfortunate for the businesses.

Quite spaces and great selection of restaurants inside the complex . Open seating is quite something to sip some iced blended coffee . Also some local boutiques available . This place has history . Perhaps , the best place for a traveler to visit in Colombo . Weekends are always busy with live music and small parties . Don's miss !

Clearly this place was aimed at the wealthy traveler. There were several western style restaurants and bars here. From the first-floor  balcony there was a nice view of the oven. There were several upmarket watch and jewelry stores in the complex as.well. Worth a look but you will find better food and much better prices elsewhere.

from ministry of crab to odel this place has it all the food options and shopping options feel premium and its not cheap. i often used to walk in the facility primarily since it has so much old world cham .  It basically a cool place to hang out at but there is no much to do other than buying stuff.
Have no doubts, this houses an assortment of some very expensive stores. But it is a great place to browse & get an idea of some souvenirs. Also has a set of great restaurants.
Nice ambience....great crowd...good eateries...one of the best places in Colombo to just relax and enjoy your evening...a must visit

This is not a tourist attraction. It is an old building that may have been used as a hospital which has been completely modernised into an average shopping mall. It is very small and the shops are not special

This is an old hospital complex renovated with great taste. The famous Ministry of Crab is located in the same venue. There is nothing much as far as shopping is concerned. Spa Ceylon has an outlet there with a spa as well. Also Nature's Secret has a beauty salon with Facials, Pedicure and manicure facilities. Good hangout place.
Love the ambience and the hype you meet friends so many people visit here Friday and Saturday night is the best!

This place was a very old dutch hospital complex. Now converted to a hot shopping mall. Very crowded and busy place as lot of locals comes here for shopping , dinning and also for spending time with their loved ones.

The Old Dutch Hospital retains its original architecture but today it is a "happening place" with trendy restaurants and cafes, a Tea Room and shops. A small area and easy to negotiate as also located centrally in the Colombo Fort area. We were there earlier this afternoon for lunch at Ministry of Crab.

A centrally located premises, on passing by we noticed shops , we thought it's a hospital but after going inside the premises we found nicely laid shops of food, jewellery, local arts & craft etc. The central court yard has place to sit and restaurant serve food and liquor there. Located exactly opposite World Trade Center..
Decent place with a decent crowd. No much of selections of shop but a posh place to hang on.Would recommend as a affordable place
The restaurants are nice, the food tasty. Although don't come to shop. The shops are too expensive for colombo.
To turn around what was such a messy place to a grand shopping mall & excellent restaurants was a great idea. Now very popular in the evening. Also with spa's. Easily accessible ♿

It is very good place. Very lively and very good live music. Different food options and lot of choice. Ambience is very good and you can enjoy live music with food. Odel and spa Ceylon is also good. Good place to spend your evening

The information provided could make you think you were visiting something unique or special,  but while the precinct has some good tourist shops and high end cafes it's a bit soulless as an area and there's no real sense of the areas heritage.

We came here on our first night by accident and at at Burger King (kids) and strolled around. A lot of what is here is a mini version or regular version of what can be found in colombo (i.e. - there is a small Barefoot here but a much bigger one with the renown cafe just a bit further into town) In any case, the cafes are cool looking and there is supposed to be a delicious seafood restaurant here, but for shopping, I would go elsewhere.
Definitely worth visiting at night. Multiple restaurants with the famous ministry of crab...nice vibe at night...
Barefoot, odel luv SL, ministry of crab...... And a lot more. Nice place with lots of space to sit and chill. Beautiful architecture. Overall good to spend half a day in Colombo.

This has various places to eat, drink and shop next to the Fort district. I ate in three (Semondu, Ministry of Crab and Ikoh Tei) and was delighted with each one. The shops seem to be chains so sell tourist tat...but very good tourist tat so are probably worth a look! It's also quite a cool place to wander round.
It's a lovely area to walk around. Quaint shops, small cafes , juice bars , spice shops!! Was a refreshing walk around...there's a lighthouse too!

It's a lovely place in Colombo carved out of a old courtyard style complex.. Its very hyped with very limited options for everything Its one of those places you have to add to your travel itinerary for the noise value Its not as compelling as it is publicised.. Dotted with a few restaurants and a few shops which every tour guide is tied up with

They have some restaurants and Sri Lanka shops and spa . Almost shops is open 1100-2200 You can get nice souvenirs but it may be a little expensive Restaurants are very nice And you should make reservation for SPA
Yes it's a cliche because it a bit posher and more western than other places, but the shops sell good quality items and the restaurants are good.

Lovely little shopping centre with a few nice shops and some lovely bars and restaurants including the Ministry of Crab which is just fantastic!   Gem stores are worth a visit very knowledgable and not at all hard sell saw one of the most beautiful cornflower blue cushion cut sapphire I have ever seen and if I have a spare $27k I will be straight back!  Lovely place worth a detour.

Nothing special here. If you've been to any souvenir shop in any country anywhere in the world, this shopping area will surely disappoint. The history of the Dutch Hospital is fascinating, but, sadly, is overshadowed by second rate souvenir shops.

We had an excellent lunch at a little restaurant around one of the squares. Must be the best Fish and Chips in Colombo! There were good classy shops in the neighbouring square.The whole place is very cool due to the clever design by the Dutch. Well worth a visit.

A colonial Dutch hospital converted into and reimagined as a shopping complex. This place makes for a great couple of hours to walk through and browse the eateries in here. It has an Odel store for shopping for knick-knacks and SL merch.

situated in heart of economical center in Colombo. Excellent place to have a business lunch or dinner out with friends. Most of the shops have traditional food and items. very clean and well trained staff. bit expensive but worth the cost. If you are traveling to Sri Lanka and staying a day or two in Colombo this a must visit place to enjoy a local meal since you don't find many places in Sri Lanka in this caliber.
One of the coolest hangout places of Colombo. Plenty to do, plenty to eat, plenty to shop! If you ever planning to visit Colombo, then this place should be on your list of places to visit

The complex has several very once restaurants and shops like Odel and a small one run by the Crafts council of Sri Lanka. There is a Spa and its a nice clean place to spend an afternoon having coffee with friends

It's a nice place for refreshing little far away from city crowd. Environment with food & music removes all your stress. Foods are very tasty & available various drinks cocktail. But pricey! And enjoyable with family.
A couple of nice shops, pretty expensive. Very expensive coffee shop with poor coffee. Not sure why this was recommended!

The Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct is one of the most attractive shopping centers in Colombo. The building was originally a hospital during the Dutch era and is considered to be the oldest building in the historic Colombo Fort area. The building is centered around two courtyards, which sometimes host live music. It has a few cafes, restaurants, shops and bars. It's a nice place to stop and enjoy the shade, and with low slung tiled roofs and attractive colonnades. Must visit Restaurants - Ministry of Crab, Semondu, Heladiv Tea Club
Not sure I'd exactly call this a shopping district. A Sri Lankan tourist shop and a barefoot fabric shop. Had a good coffee here but definitely not a shopping destination. Easily skip this.
Good choice of restaurants and bars in the old fort area, attracts locals and tourists, walking distance from Galle Face Hotel and about $1 return in a Tuk Tuk
This building were hospital in 18th century, bur now is full of good restaurants, souvenir shops and tea places. I like it very much! Recommended!

The old dutch hospital now converted to shopping area and cafes...offers nice live music at various cafes in an open setting...very centrally located and also houses spa ceylon and ministry of crab...a must visit place

The closest landmark to the Dutch Hospital is the Pettah bus stand. The hospital has been converted to a shopping district now and houses a number of high end restaurants such as Ministry of Crabs, etc. The ideal time for a visit should be during twilight hours where the entire place is light up. Overall a it is very good for leisurely strolls for about 30 minutes. Shopping here is limited

It was raining when I was there but that didn't stop me from enjoying this place. So much restaurants, tea place and spa to enjoy. It is a place where you can just enjoy the day. Something different from everything.
Came here on arrival in SL. Told by guide to visit. Great atmosphere, live music, lovely choices of places to eat. Loved it !!!!!
Good looking renovated courtyard with shops. Shops seem expensive. Restaurants and bars in the area Just felt a bit false and specific to tourists as near a lot of international hotels
From lovely shops & spa's  to great tea / coffee / drinks / food outlets all in one place ! Evenings are the loveliest here

The Dutch Hospital buildings were very impressive and worth seeing, but the charm ended there. We found the shopping to be virtually non existent, food options commercial and unappealing. This is such a delightful space that could have been so appealing, but wasn't. The colonial buildings surrounding the area and the environment itself could have made this such a draw card for Colombo which many travel reviewers advise visitors to use only as a transit stop.

column7: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
column11: The place seems very old but renovated and clean. They say the first coffee shop was started in the morgue which has ever since been removed. It is mostly restaurant with a few shops selling souvenirs. The famous Ministry of Crab restaurant is in the location which is you must eat in it.
It was a great place for shopping! we loved the atmosphere but seemed a bit over priced! A shopping precinct with a touch of history really delighted us!
I enjoy the atmosphere of this place. It's very laid back. Brilliant place to relax and take a breather.
Built around an old courtyard the precinct has a great atmosphere and a good variety of shops and eateries to suit most tastes. Great for an evening out wining and dining.

It is a heritage building, now closely surrounded by tall towers and skyscrapers. It is a good hangout destination if you are willing to spend. There are some restaurants and gift shops in its premises. Besides these, there is nothing much to do or see here. You may finish taking a round of this building in 15 minutes.

I would call it a shopping precinct, more a dining one. The ministry of crab is situated there which is just bustling with people. A few shops. An Odel which is not as nice as the one in Galle Dutch hospital precinct. A small Barfefoot which was closed when we got there @ 8pm and possible one or 2 more stores.

We went for dinner at the ministry  of crab - it was great, I recommend it. We had a wander around, the building  is lovely. Shops and restaurant definitely for high end tourists. I went in the gift shop and was surprised how reasonable it was, they have a nice selection of elephant and turtle related products, it was handy for last minute gifts!
Although there are a few items only, they are of good class. I took some of my friends who just wanted to see, but ended up buying lots of stuff.

A place so small and yet so much happening! it doesn't look so good from outside, but inside has been restored so nicely some great and elegant and fine dining restaurants and coffee/ tea shops.. it also has some really cool pubs, one of them was in the open with live band playing some of my favorite songs. Its such a happy place, people eating, drinking and dancing. Must go!

What used to be a hospital has been restored into a lovely meeting/eating place.  Once you enter into the courtyard, you are surrounded by a collection of restaurants and boutique shops.  The centre of the courtyard has cement tables & chairs to sit and relax which also double as seating for some of the restaurants.  If you do choose an outdoor seat, beware of the potential for rain as the courtyard is open air and not undercover. There are two courtyards that run parallel so you should have a wander around so you don't miss anything.  Barefoot is down a side lane and ODEL is at one end of the first courtyard.  There is also The Ministry of Crab, The Fort Cafe, The Tea centre, Ayurvedic Spa, the Taphouse, Burger King and many more. Outside of the hospital there are many tuk-tuks waiting to take you to your next destination.  It's very close to The Kingsbury Hotel and the fabulous Colombo City Walks departs from there also.  Definitely worth a visit if for nothing else than the history of the building and its restoration in the last decade.

Old hospital had been converted to a nice shopping and dining area. It has number of restaurants with different types of food. Pub is also good. Situated in the heart of Colombo . Limited parking space in the front of the Dutch hospital is not adquate.

i only did a little bit of window shopping. when i did go in, some shops did not stock items that were popularly in demand.  cost is high too. i guess the high overheads are taken into account.  anyway not much in the way of shoppers. people who do come either sit around or walk leisurely.

With a number of eating outlets, Dutch hospital is definitely a lively and an interesting place to hang out. There are a number of interesting restaurants including the ministry of crab which is a Michelin star level restaurant. There are a few shops but nothing too exciting. Odel LUV SL shop is worth a visit...
Nice relaxed area to wander. Touristy shops and nice restaurants. Clean toilets. When we were there a band was playing in the evening. Tried to get in to ministry of crab for lunch but very full.

We strolled into this area looking for a restaurant for lunch. There are many cafe and retaruants here including a michelin star! it has a lively atmosphere with many tourists. Ceylon spa and odel are here too.

A trip here is like going back in colonial times!. The stores n restaurants are all set in the colonial style. A must visit when ur in downtown Cmb!. Will sure be back again during our next visit to Cmb!. All the very best!. :))

Dutch hospital is a beautiful colonial building restored to its former glory, Housing many good eating places it is a popular meeting place in Colombo.I like to sit in the court yard and watch the evening activity around me.Even the shops have their own atmosphere enhanced by artful decor. you can have a mealor sip a drink while watching the busy city  landscpe change with night,. A good relaxing atmosphere. Some eateries are so busy you may have to wait so it is  better to book a table early.
Just a shopping centre for tourists. Overpriced fancy  restaurants and shops. The building is nice, historical. It was a hospital before but I would rather choose another place for food or shopping.
Two or three shops selling a variety of knick knacks and some extremely good restaurants. Not much more to say... but try the Black Beef Curry, very special
An oldest building in the Colombo. It is now a heritage building & a shopping & dining precinct. Historical and cultural heritage.

What is all the fuss about? A couple of shops and the rest restaurants and cafes. Not what we were expecting at all. Had a half decent meal in the best looking restaurant but that was it. Didn't fit the description of what we were expecting at all!

Dutch hospital shopping precincts is an experience more than the shopping..the amazing architecture is the thing that makes you feel like that.A must place to visit in Colombo.Other than the shopping you can enjoy tasty delicious cuisines there and also relax a bit in the spas there...it is located well in the centre of the city near trade centre which itself is a building to watch for the architecture and scale.An experience one should not miss overall.
Small, quaint place with shopping n cafeterias ,,, very interesting to spend evening with drinks, good crowd and live music. Would strongly recommend everyone to spend an evening there.
Good for a wander and a juice to get out of the heat.  A few western eatieries and gift shops. Beautiful buildings

We thoroughly enjoyed a lazy afternoon, strolling through the alleyways, remarking to one another on the heavy Dutch doors and window shutters with ancient hinges. The t Lounge was a nostalgic experience of luxurious teas in a charming setting. The local Steuart hotel is a capsule of Scottish culture and clans in its theme, although we didn't stay there... Just enjoying the sights and sounds. My mother's maiden name was on the wall, so very nostalgic! The Barefoot shop is fantastic, with lovely, thick hand-woven Sri Lankan cotton at a reasonable price per meter. Some of the spots are bit more expensive than other places in Sri Lanka, but many are the same price as elsewhere. A truly must do and see place... Something for every pocket.

There is Avirate, LuvSL/Odel and Barefoot if you are trying to find a quick gift, something to wear or a quick lunch out with a colleague or impromptu dinner plans. There's Ministry of Crab, Harpos, Tap House, Chinese Dragon depending on your budget to choose from :)

Well, I am not rich enough to throw $40-$50 away for a crab dish or buy a printed T-shirt for a $10-$15. I can do all that for half the price elsewhere in Colombo. Sorry, not my cup of tea! its very expencive place for ordinary people to shopping, good for tourist because they can buy for this price

With restaurants and cafes around, I found the place comfortable. We tried different types of tea - good experience. Ministry of Crab was closed at that time, so couldn't try that. Visited during Sep 2012.

Loved the energy here..sat by and watched a band play live music.. The cafes adn shops are iconic and little pricey. BUt you can pick up knick knacks at Odel, get a massage at Spa Ceylon and have a meal at Ministry of Crab.

The building has been restored beautifully and is very reminicent of the old Dutch architecture. However, I was disappointed with the shops in this precinct as they were similar to other shops and a bit pricey. The ' ministry of crab' was a good place to eat and there was a Japanese sea food restaurant there too, so good place to eat.
Never get sick of walking around this place as it's full of restaurants and other stuff. Love the weekend live music at RnR

There are only a few shops in the complex, quite upscale and everything else are restaurants. If you are traveling on a budget, this is not the place for you. It's nice to see it and wonder around for a bit, but that's about it. If you are in the area, you should check it out.

This is not as big as it seems in some pictures. It's a nice place for a lunch or snacks. There are different kinds of restaurants, local gem stones and cafe's in a courtyard style place. A must visit for tourists, although we couldn't eat as we got their very late at night but we went again early morning and took some pictures. It closes at 11pm so make sure you go before that. Loved the place, great to chill out with a drink whilst listening to live music. We went there on a Saturday night. Had street food at Galle Face Green then came here to chill out. Don't expect too much! Nice enough if you want to pop in for a bite to eat or get some shade but the courtyard really is quite small and there aren't many shops.

Very nice atmosphere, with good choices of restaurants and bars. The common area is very relaxing with good breeze. Clean place, gives an easy and relaxing atmosphere.

The Old Dutch Hospital is considered to be the oldest building in the historic Colombo Fort area. It is believed to have existed since 1681, built as a hospital during the Dutch occupation of Sri Lanka, it has been used for several different purposes. The Dutch established the Colombo Hospital to look after the health of the officers and other staff serving under the Dutch East India Company. The building reflects seventeenth century Dutch colonial architecture. It was the Colombo Fort Police Station from the early 1980s to 1990s, prior to which it housed the Colombo Apothecaries. In 2011 it has been transformed into small new shopping complex, where the historic architecture has been preserved. It has few nice shops, few lovely tearoom - cafes and restaurants. It's a nice place with nice ambience to stop and enjoy shopping and a cold tea in the shade under the low tiled roofs and attractive colonnades.

We were recommend this place by our travel agent. This beautiful, quaint building holds several high end shops including Barefoot and Odel. As well as popular restaurants - Ministry of Crab, Burger King and others. We visited Tap House, very popular place with the locals as well as tourist. They have tables set in the courtyard where you can enjoy your drinks while listening to the live band.

Its a lovely place, with a nice ambiance, its also one of the few places in Colombo that is wheel chair accessible and for parents of toddlers its easy to take your stroller. If you enjoy Japanese, the Japanese restaurant; Ikoi Tei is a good place to dine. However I find the shopping there to be rather expensive, as it caters to tourists, hence if your looking to buy souvenirs I'd say the best is go to a place like Lakpahana or Laksala, as they are more reasonable.

The street has a vintage feel. I visited Odel which was highly recommended by other reviewers. However, I was not impressed. There are a few good food joints around, though. A good time spent sitting and enjoying the ambience with friends and family.

Some lovely tourist shops (Odel & Barefoot) but if you're looking for variety, I recommend heading to their flagship stores instead. Some bars and cafes if you've time to kill but definitely not the best that Colombo has to offer. Historically and architecture-wise, this is a great building design to appreciate, built in the 17th century Dutch colonial architecture style.

Boutique tea places, Burger King, and branch of Odel (a chain of shops with tourist bits) Nothing of any interest in my opinion (unless you like crab as I understand the restaurant tucked in the corner is tasty)

A few interesting outlets such as Barefoot and Colombo Jewellery Stores, which have much larger and extensive shops elsewhere in the city, together with a number of restaurants. The recently renovated and salvaged buildings are worth seeing. This is fast becoming an in place for tourists and locals.
The most remarkable and considered make over of a historical landmark in Colombo. Absolutely beautiful with a wide range of restaurants and other minor shops, but do take the trouble to visit.
Best food, value for money, excellent crowd, what else you can ask? There is a bonus, live music during weekends.

Although it is much smaller than I would have expected and the variety of shops limited, it is still worth to visit and hang around. The 17th Century building is a masterpiece of Dutch architecture and one of the oldest buildings within Galle Fort, situated close to the Court Square. The best place for a beer is Tap House. They have tables outside on the courtyard too. Most of the shops are expensive jewelers, but the quality of the products are very good and genuine. On the first floor are many restaurants where you can get a good meal for a reasonable price. If you want many people around you, visit the complex in the weekends, because the Colombo crowd is coming to the Fort. Nice view from the upper floor balcony over the bay.

The term "shopping precinct" is a misnomer as this place is dominated by restaurants. The 17th century Dutch colonial architecture has been well-preserved, though the area is small - so there's not a lot to marvel at. If your hotel is around the area (and there are several) this looks like a good area to hang out 'til late with friends.

It was a nice place to chill and relax in the evenings along with having dinner or a small snack. In the day time im not sp sure how it goes but after sunset its much more fun and enjoyable to walk around.
